CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The decent hole mobilities of both copolymers can be attributed to high crystallinity of the copolymers due to the highly coplanar structure of anthracene and DPP. It is also understood that the 3-fold higher chargecarrier mobility of PTATDPP than that of PTAFDPP arises from its stronger π-π stacking with a shorter d 010 , as discussed above. When the photovoltaic properties of copolymers are measured using PC71BM as an electron acceptor , it is found that the optimum blend ratio of polymer : PC71BM is 1 : 2 to afford the best PCE of both copolymers with the conventional device architecture of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / Ca / Al ( Fig. S2 and Table S1 † ). The best PCE was also achieved when o-dichlorobenzene was used as a solvent and the optimum thickness for the active layer was ca. 90 nm. The current density - voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the optimized solar cells are shown in Fig. 4 , and the relevant photovoltaic parameters of the devices are summarized in Tables 2 and S2. † PTATDPP showed a best PCE of 6.69% ( V OC = 0.80 V , J SC = 12.3 mA cm^-2 , FF = 0.68 ) , while PTAFDPP showed a best PCE of 5.02% ( V OC = 0.76 V , J SC = 11.2 mA cm^-2 , FF = 0.59 ). Both copolymers showed higher V OC s than other DPP - based copolymers due to their low - lying HOMO energy levels. Both copolymers also exhibited high J SC s and FFs , indicating their decent ability for charge generation and transport. Therefore , the TA unit is a promising electron - donating unit for low band - gap copolymers with a low - lying HOMO energy level. When the PSC devices were fabricated with an inverted architecture ( ITO / ZnO / polymer : PC71BM / MoO 3 / Ag ) in order to further improve the photovoltaic performance , the PCEs of PTATDPP and PTAFDPP - based devices were improved to 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively ( Fig. 4b , Tables 2 and S2 † ) , mainly due to enhanced J SC s ( V OC s and FFs were not changed significantly ). It is noteworthy here that the PCE of over 7% of PTATDPP is the highest efficiency of anthracene - based low band - gap conjugated copolymers. In spite of the same band - gap of the two copolymers , PTATDPP shows slightly higher J SC and FF than PTAFDPP ( Fig. S3 † ). This can be ascribed to the closely packed microstructures of PTATDPP and thereby its high charge - carrier mobility than PTAFDPP. When the crystal structures of blend films of the copolymers with PC71BM were examined by XRD , the PTATDPP / PC71BM blend had strong and intense ( 100 ) diffraction while the PTAFDPP / PC71BM blend showed weak and broad ( 100 ) diffraction ( Fig. 2b ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PTATDPP |
| PTAFDPP |
| PC71BM |
| ITO |
| PEDOT |
| PSS |
| Ca |
| Al |
| o-dichlorobenzene |
| MoO3 |
| Ag |
| ZnO |

Note: The material names are presented in the same words as in the original paragraph, and they are listed in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PTATDPP |
| PTAFDPP |
| PC71BM |
| ITO |
| PEDOT |
| PSS |

Note: The entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" are:

* "Ca" (calcium)
* "Al" (aluminum)
* "o-dichlorobenzene" (solvent)
* "MoO3" (molybdenum oxide)
* "Ag" (silver)
* "ZnO" (zinc oxide)

These entities are not presented in the Markdown table as they do not clearly refer to material names.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The decent hole mobilities of both copolymers can be attributed to high crystallinity of the copolymers due to the highly coplanar structure of anthracene and DPP. It is also understood that the 3-fold higher chargecarrier mobility of PTATDPP than that of PTAFDPP arises from its stronger π-π stacking with a shorter d 010 , as discussed above. When the photovoltaic properties of copolymers are measured using PC71BM as an electron acceptor , it is found that the optimum blend ratio of polymer : PC71BM is 1 : 2 to afford the best PCE of both copolymers with the conventional device architecture of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / Ca / Al ( Fig. S2 and Table S1 † ). The best PCE was also achieved when o-dichlorobenzene was used as a solvent and the optimum thickness for the active layer was ca. 90 nm. The current density - voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the optimized solar cells are shown in Fig. 4 , and the relevant photovoltaic parameters of the devices are summarized in Tables 2 and S2. † PTATDPP showed a best PCE of 6.69% ( V OC = 0.80 V , J SC = 12.3 mA cm^-2 , FF = 0.68 ) , while PTAFDPP showed a best PCE of 5.02% ( V OC = 0.76 V , J SC = 11.2 mA cm^-2 , FF = 0.59 ). Both copolymers showed higher V OC s than other DPP - based copolymers due to their low - lying HOMO energy levels. Both copolymers also exhibited high J SC s and FFs , indicating their decent ability for charge generation and transport. Therefore , the TA unit is a promising electron - donating unit for low band - gap copolymers with a low - lying HOMO energy level. When the PSC devices were fabricated with an inverted architecture ( ITO / ZnO / polymer : PC71BM / MoO 3 / Ag ) in order to further improve the photovoltaic performance , the PCEs of PTATDPP and PTAFDPP - based devices were improved to 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively ( Fig. 4b , Tables 2 and S2 † ) , mainly due to enhanced J SC s ( V OC s and FFs were not changed significantly ). It is noteworthy here that the PCE of over 7% of PTATDPP is the highest efficiency of anthracene - based low band - gap conjugated copolymers. In spite of the same band - gap of the two copolymers , PTATDPP shows slightly higher J SC and FF than PTAFDPP ( Fig. S3 † ). This can be ascribed to the closely packed microstructures of PTATDPP and thereby its high charge - carrier mobility than PTAFDPP. When the crystal structures of blend films of the copolymers with PC71BM were examined by XRD , the PTATDPP / PC71BM blend had strong and intense ( 100 ) diffraction while the PTAFDPP / PC71BM blend showed weak and broad ( 100 ) diffraction ( Fig. 2b ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| crystallinity |
| π-π stacking |
| d 010 |
| chargecarrier mobility |
| optimum blend ratio |
| PCE |
| V OC |
| J SC |
| FF |
| HOMO energy level |
| J SC s |
| FFs |
| PSC devices |
| inverted architecture |
| MoO 3 |
| Ag |
| XRD |
| ( 100 ) diffraction |

Note:

* d 010 refers to the interlayer distance between the copolymer and the PC71BM molecules.
* HOMO energy level refers to the highest occupied molecular orbital energy level.
* J SC s and FFs refer to the current density and fill factor, respectively, of the solar cells.
* PSC devices and inverted architecture refer to the photovoltaic devices and their architecture, respectively, with the order of layers being inverted.
* XRD refers to X-ray diffraction.
* ( 100 ) diffraction refers to the diffraction pattern of the blend films of the copolymers with PC71BM, with the (100) plane being the most intense and sharp diffraction peak.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Property name of material" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| crystallinity |
| π-π stacking |
| d 010 |
| chargecarrier mobility |
| optimum blend ratio |
| PCE |
| V OC |
| J SC |
| FF |

Note:

* d 010 refers to the interlayer distance between the copolymer and the PC71BM molecules.
* PCE, V OC, J SC, and FF refer to the photovoltaic performance parameters of the solar cells, specifically, power conversion efficiency, open-circuit voltage, short-circuit current, and fill factor, respectively.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 3-fold | Charge carrier mobility of PTATDPP compared to PTAFDPP |
| 010 | d-spacing of PTATDPP, leading to stronger π-π stacking |

| 5.22% | Improved PCE of PTAFDPP with inverted architecture |
| 100 | Diffraction intensity of PTATDPP / PC71BM blend (XRD) |
